entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Knots 0.18.0.knots20190502 released
entry.summary: Bitcoin Knots has released version 0.18.0.knots20190502, containing new features, bug fixes, and performance improvements for Linux kernel, macOS 10.10+, and Windows 7 and above. Bitcoin Knots recommends that users do not use the software on unsupported systems and shut down current versions before running the installer. The update also includes changes in the build system and tests and QA. The Bitcoin Core development team has made numerous updates and improvements to the platform, including improving dry running, fixing issues, adding invalid P2P message tests, enabling BDB Unicode support, and updating the Univalue subtree. They have also added tests for truncated pushdata script, consensus, and wallet errors, among others, and made improvements to platform support on Windows. The Bitcoin Core team has released version 0.18.0 of the software, promising significant performance improvements and bug fixes. The update includes better privacy by default, support for fractional satoshis, and a new feature that allows users to generate bech32 addresses. Additionally, the release notes include several bug fixes and documentation improvements. The release is backwards-compatible with older versions of the software and users are encouraged to upgrade as soon as possible.The provided context is a digitally signed message part using the application/pgp-signature format. The signature confirms the authenticity and integrity of the message, which is likely an encrypted email sent using PGP encryption software. Digital signatures ensure that a message or document has not been tampered with during transmission and are used for secure communication between individuals and organizations who deal with sensitive information.
